Body: I'm not exactly sure what you're looking for here, but to give you an example of a language that you could say does show this, you could look at Welsh. There are girls' names that end, for example, with the suffix -wen (e.g. Branwen, Gwen, Awen) where the suffix carries the meaning 'white, fair'. There is a masculine counterpart to this in names like Gwyn or Wyn, also carrying the meaning 'white'.
